intro: Corydalis latiflora, commonly known as the broadleaf corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features slender, branched stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, while the flowers are arranged in clusters at the tips of the stems. Corydalis latiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
